newsitem.title: GERMANY: Asiana launches weekly Seoul-Frankfurt flight May.
newsitem.headline: Asiana launches weekly Seoul-Frankfurt flight May.

text.p: South Korean carrier Asiana Airlines will start weekly flights between Seoul and Frankfurt from May 29, Flughafen Frankfurt AG (FAG) said.
But a planned second weekly flight has been delayed until spring 1998, an FAG statement said.
On March 19 an FAG statement said that Asiana would launch twice-weekly flights to Frankfurt at the end of May.
The Seoul-Frankfurt flight will be operated with a Boeing 747-400 combi version with a cargo capacity of 36 tonnes.
Cargo sales in Germany are being handled by Aerotrans Luftfahrtagentur GmbH.

FAG said 175 slots a week, or 12 more than last summer, would be used this summer by airlines to fly to Far East destinations, a far higher figure than rivals such as Paris Charles de Gaulle or Amsterdam.
With Asiana there would be 22 airlines serving 25 destinations in 18 Far East countries from Frankfurt, FAG added.
